entries.title: The US House may not have a speaker when it convenes. Here’s why
entries.description: Republican House leader Kevin McCarthy may fall short of securing majority amid opposition from far-right party members.

entries.title: Florida islands face ‘crisis’ as nearly 500 asylum seekers arrive
entries.description: A severe economic downturn in Cuba has fuelled record migration to the United States, with boat crossings on the rise.

entries.title: Bolivia sees more unrest following opposition leader’s arrest
entries.description: Protesters in farming hub of Santa Cruz province block highways as calls grow for release of Luis Fernando Camacho.

entries.title: What can Lula deliver for Brazil?
entries.description: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is back in power for a third presidential term.

entries.title: Tennis great Navratilova vows to fight double cancer diagnosis
entries.description: The 18-time Grand Slam singles champion says she is hoping for positive outcome after throat, breast cancer diagnosis.

entries.title: California braces for more heavy rain after days of flooding
entries.description: A plume of moisture from the Pacific Ocean is expected to bring additional rainfall to the US state in the coming days.

entries.title: Egypt repatriates looted ancient Green Coffin sarcophagus from US
entries.description: The sarcophagus, returned at a ceremony, dates back to the Late Dynastic Period of ancient Egypt, officials say.

entries.title: Uganda New Year’s event organiser arrested after deadly stampede
entries.description: The incident at Kampala's Freedom City shopping centre killed 10 people, including children.

entries.title: Missouri set to execute first transgender person in the US
entries.description: Amber McLaughlin faces death by legal injection on Tuesday, after being convicted of first-degree murder in 2006.

entries.title: Germany’s defence minister in hot water over New Year’s video
entries.description: Christine Lambrecht speaks of Ukraine war in front of New Year's celebrations in an address criticised as tone-deaf.

entries.title: Photos: Brazil begins paying final respects to legend Pele
entries.description: Pele is considered by many to be the greatest football player of all time, the only one to win three World Cups.

entries.title: Vietnam rescuers battle to save boy, 10, stuck in concrete pile
entries.description: Emergency workers receive no response from boy two days after he fell into a 35-metre pillar at a construction site.

entries.title: After year of ‘unprecedented crises’, what next for Haiti?
entries.description: From gangs to fuel shortages to a cholera outbreak, Haiti is grappling with ongoing setbacks as new year begins.

entries.title: Russia says 63 troops killed in Ukrainian attack on Makiivka
entries.description: Ukraine puts death toll from New Year's Eve strike in the occupied city of Makiivka at 400 Russian soldiers.

entries.title: Senegalese lawmakers get 6-month jail term for colleague assault
entries.description: Amadou Niang and Massata Samb were ordered to pay more than $8,000 in compensation to fellow MP Amy Ndiaye Gniby.

entries.title: Malawi keeps schools shut as cholera deaths surge
entries.description: Cholera is an annual problem during Malawi's November-March rainy months, but the current outbreak is especially severe.

entries.title: Searching for Oman: Towards a disconnected 2023
entries.description: Last month, I tried to recreate the serenity of a past camping trip in Oman by disconnecting from the internet.

entries.title: US drops Burkina Faso from Africa duty-free trade programme
entries.description: The US Trade Representative's office said the decision was due to concerns over 'unconstitutional change' in government.

entries.title: Which countries have placed COVID curbs on travellers from China?
entries.description: Governments cite lack of information from Beijing on variants as they express concerns over a new wave of infections.

entries.title: Tunisian transport strike adds more woes for President Saied
entries.description: Metro and bus traffic grounds to a halt in Tunis as employees go on strike over pay and bonuses.

entries.title: Four dead in midair helicopter collision in Australia
entries.description: One helicopter appeared to be taking off and other landing when they collided near Sea World theme park in Queensland.

entries.title: Cost of living: A refugee family runs out of food in Hong Kong
entries.description: Banned from working, a refugee family from Bangladesh tries to survive in one of the world's most expensive cities.

entries.title: Reporting in Gaza, a new year brings the same harsh reality
entries.description: Life in Gaza has a recurrent theme, one of repetitive hardships, without the prospect of any improvement.

entries.title: Dubai drops 30 percent tax on alcohol to woo tourists, expats
entries.description: The changes took effect on Sunday and will run for a one-year trial period, according to domestic media.

entries.title: Actor Jeremy Renner ‘critical but stable’ after snowplough mishap
entries.description: The US movie star had been ploughing snow at his property near Reno, Nevada when he suffered serious injuries.

entries.title: Israeli forces kill two Palestinian men in occupied West Bank
entries.description: Mohammad Hoshiyeh and Fouad Abed were the first Palestinians killed by Israeli forces this year.

entries.title: India’s Supreme Court says 2016 demonetisation decision was legal
entries.description: Five-judge bench upholds legality of government move to demonetise 86 percent of the country's cash in circulation.

entries.title: New Year cruise stranded off Australia over hull ‘marine growth’
entries.description: Passengers stranded for a week as divers remove accumulation of microorganisms, plants, algae or small animals on hull.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 313
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 313th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Pope Benedict XVI’s body to lie in state at St Peter’s Basilica
entries.description: Thousands expected to pay their last respects to the former pope, whose body will lie in state for three days.

entries.title: Chinese return to regular activities amid COVID surge
entries.description: Some residents in cities like Beijing, Shanghai and Wuhan are getting back to normal life after 'zero-COVOD' measures.

entries.title: Fired during COVID, Bali’s low paid now demand double the pay
entries.description: Employers are struggling to fill positions as tourism roars back to life on popular resort island.

entries.title: S Korea, US discussing joint nuclear exercises, says Yoon
entries.description: President says US assurances of 'extended deterrence' no longer enough in face of North Korea's nuclear capabilities.

entries.title: 14 killed in attack on prison in Mexico border city
entries.description: Ten prison guards and four inmates killed after gunmen attack prison in Ciudad Juarez, say officials.

entries.title: Air raid sirens in Kyiv as Russia launches fresh drone attacks
entries.description: Ukrainian officials say at least one wounded in waves of Russian drone attacks on Kyiv's critical infrastructure.

entries.title: 2023 to be tougher for global economy than 2022, IMF chief says
entries.description: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva says one-third of world's economies expected to be in recession this year.

entries.title: Israeli raid shuts down Damascus airport, says Syrian military
entries.description: Two soldiers killed as air raid puts Damascus airport out of service for the second time in less than a year.
